org.cpsolver.ifs.assignment.context

Class DefaultSingleAssignmentContextHolder<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cpsolver.ifs.assignment.context.AssignmentContextHolderMap<V,T>
      • org.cpsolver.ifs.assignment.context.DefaultSingleAssignmentContextHolder<V,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Variable
    T - Value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AssignmentContextHolder<V,T>

    public class DefaultSingleAssignmentContextHolder<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>
extends AssignmentContextHolderMap<V,T>
    A simple assignment context holder implementation used by the DefaultSingleAssignment class. CanHoldContext are used when possible, storing contexts in arrays of length 1 (one context per HasAssignmentContext class).
    Version:
    IFS 1.3 (Iterative Forward Search)
    Copyright (C) 2014 Tomáš Müller
    muller@unitime.org
    http://muller.unitime.org

    Author:
    Tomáš Müller
    See Also:
    AssignmentContext, AssignmentContextReference, AssignmentContextHolder

    • Method Detail

      • getAssignmentContext

        public <U extends AssignmentContext> U getAssignmentContext(Assignment<V,T> assignment,
                                                            AssignmentContextReference<V,T,U> reference)
        Description copied from interface: AssignmentContextHolder
        Return assignment context for the given assignment and reference. A new assignment context is created when there is not assignment context associated with the given reference yet.
        Specified by:
        getAssignmentContext in interface AssignmentContextHolder<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>
        Overrides:
        getAssignmentContext in class AssignmentContextHolderMap<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>
        Type Parameters:
        U - assignment context type
        Parameters:
        assignment - current assignment (there is only one assignment associated with one holder, but the assignment is passed so that HasAssignmentContext.createAssignmentContext(Assignment) can be called if needed
        reference - a reference created by calling Model.createReference(HasAssignmentContext)
        Returns:
        an assignment context

      • clearContext

        public <C extends AssignmentContext> void clearContext(AssignmentContextReference<V,T,C> reference)
        Description copied from interface: AssignmentContextHolder
        Clear an assignment context that is associated with the given a reference. If there is any created for the reference.
        Specified by:
        clearContext in interface AssignmentContextHolder<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>
        Overrides:
        clearContext in class AssignmentContextHolderMap<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>
        Type Parameters:
        C - assignment context type
        Parameters:
        reference - a reference (which can be stored within the model, e.g., as an instance variable of a constraint)
